Finding jobs and internships
Looking for that one ideal internship to practice your skills in an impactful environment? Looking to join the CS workforce? Weâ€™ve got you covered! Check out all the career help and job boards here!

To get started, you can:

check out what we have!

Resources

  • Internships
  • Jobs
  • Career service
Untapped

Untapped is a recruiting platform for those underrepresented in tech.

Jopwell

A one-stop shop for internships, jobs, and stories from diverse coders!

Finternz

Find internships that suit you!



Meta University

A training program that can help people underrepresented in computer science develop the skills needed to succeed!

RippleMatch

Matches you with internships catered to your interests and preferred geographic area.

Handshake

Find internships and apply for them all within the app! You can also access Wellesleyâ€™s career services from here.



SquadJobs

SquadJobs provides a platform for diverse programmers to connect with jobs on diverse teams.

Breakout List

SquadJobs provides a platform for diverse programmers to connect with jobs on diverse teams.



Untapped

Untapped is a recruiting platform for those underrepresented in tech.

Jopwell

A one-stop shop for internships, jobs, and stories from diverse coders!

Black Tech Unplugged

The Black Tech Unplugged podcast is a podcast about the stories of Black people in tech!



Tech Queens

Podcast featuring the stories of various women of color in tech!

Coding Black Females

Podcast featuring various Black women coders and a variety of topics!

ComputerScience.org

Website that has career advice articles as well some interviews with people in CS!



Pramp

A website where you can do live mock interviews with a peer!

Video Interview Bot

Practice your interview skills and record yourself answering realistic *behavioral* questions!

Interviewing.io

Anonymous technical mock interviews with engineers from Google, Facebook, and other top companies!



GeeksForGeeks

A website filled with articles, tutorials on different languages, practice problems, interview prep, and more!



Contact Us


This site is only possible through the efforts of students and educators like you. If you have a resource you think could be added to the page, an idea for a page on TransparenCS, or any critiques, suggestions, funny memes, questions, or poems, please contact us!
